Presenting Problem / Chief Complaint: The patient has been keeping busy with home projects and is considering a trip to the east coast in the fall, drawn by the changing seasons and historical sites.
History of Present Illness (HPI): The patient experiences stress primarily from work deadlines and social situations, which can trigger unhealthy eating habits.
Mental Health Observations: The patient is making efforts to engage more socially and is mindful of their eating habits.
Physiological Observations: The patient feels more energetic when adhering to their meal plan but occasionally struggles with temptations.
Current Functional Status: The patient attended a gathering and made an effort to engage with new people, resulting in a positive conversation.
Progress Evaluation: The patient is making progress in social engagement and mindfulness regarding eating habits.
Therapeutic Interventions: The patient has been practicing meal prepping and is exploring conversation starters to ease social anxiety.
Next Steps: The patient aims to engage in at least three meaningful conversations at their next social event and will work on integrating stress-relief techniques into their routine.
